rename.from: DefaultHttp2ConnectionDecoder triggers stream channel closes more eagerly than it shoul
rename.to: DefaultHttp2ConnectionDecoder triggers stream channel closes more eagerly than it should

body: @normanmaurer, yes. I suspect it will be either really easy or really hard.

issue.title: Eagerly propagate GOAWAY frames from the Http2FrameCodec

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Motivation:

Users of the Http2FrameCodec are notified of inbound GoAwayFrames
after the connection has already closed any ignored streams, potentially
losing the signal that some streams may have been ignored by the peer and
are thus retryable.

Modifications:

The Http2FrameCodec more eagerly sends the Http2GoAwayFrame from the
ConnectionListener which happens before the connection closes ignored
streams.

Result:
Fixes #9986

issue.title: DefaultHttp2ConnectionDecoder notifies frame listener before connection of GOAWAYS

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Motivation:

Users of the DefaultHttp2ConnectionDecodcer are notified of inbound GoAwayFrames
after the connection has already closed any ignored streams, potentially
losing the signal that some streams may have been ignored by the peer and
are thus retryable.

Modifications:

Reorder the notifications of the frame and connection listeners to
propagate the frame first, giving the frame listeners the opportunity to
clean up ignored streams in their own way.

Result:
Fixes #9986
